result.execSummary:
The defendant Phillip James Westvik was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Possession of Methamphetamine, a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(3g)(g).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes:
If probation is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant in favor of restitution to victims and/or governmental entities for the balance due.  All available enforcement actions will be used to collect the debt.
Concurrent with: CONCURRENT TO MINNESOTA PAROLE

miscConds.notes: Comply with any conditions imposed by the probation agent.

Court reviews plea questionnaire.

Froelich:  def to plead guilty to Ct 1 - continue with MN probation and 3 years probation to run concurrent with MN probation.  Atty Nelson and def agree.    Constitutional rights explained to defendant  Exam'd re: understanding of law, penalty and rights   Def states he is in treatment now.  Court explains probation and possible revocation of probation.  Def is a citizen, but not a veteran.  Def pleads guilty to Ct 1  Possession of Meth   Atty Nelson stips to the facts in the complaint.    COURT ACCEPTS PLEA, FINDS DEF FREELY, INTELLIGENTLY, KNOWINGLY & UNDERSTANDINGLY MADE AND WAIVES CONSTITUTIONAL RIGHTS  The court finds the defendant guilty and adjudicates the def guilty of Ct 1 Possession of Meth.   Froelich makes sentencing argument.  Def has sat 4 months jail.  He has a prior history.  Atty Nelson makes sentencing argument.  Def makes statement.  Court addresses the defendant.  
COURT ORDERS:  S/W Probation 3 years - conc to MN parole 
Conditions:  conditions of probation to be determined by the probation agent, court costs $268 plus $250 DNA surcharge
Appeal rights are given to the defendant.
